title: Parts & Wholesale Consultant
description:
Are you looking for a full-time position in a line of work you have a passion for? Do you enjoy working in a fun team atmosphere and have a love for all things powersports & marine? You may be just the right fit our company!

Go Powersports Limited is looking for a Parts Wholesale Consultant at their Kentville location!

We are an award-winning Powersports company located in Western Nova Scotia. Our core focus is to bring Moments of Joy to our customers and employees alike. We are the only authorised dealer in Western NS for both BRP & CFMoto. We sell Can-Am off-road and on-road vehicles, Ski-Doo snowmobiles and Sea-Doo personal watercraft. We also offer marine products such as Alumacraft boats, Manitou Pontoons and Sealver Wave boats.

Want to join our dynamic team? Send us a paragraph about who you are and what you're looking for!

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $35,000.00-$45,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Commission pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Life insurance
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:
We follow the most current NS Public Health recommendations and require all staff members be up-to-date on the recommended vaccination schedule.

Application question(s):

  • Go Powersports Ltd. will find the right position for and train any new hires who are good match to our company core values. Please describe for us in a paragraph who you are, what you're looking for in a career and why Go Powersports Ltd.!

title: Experienced Environmental Consultant
description:
WSP is one of the world's leading professional services firms. Our purpose is to future proof our cities and environments.

We have over 55,000 team members across the globe. In Canada, our 9,800+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transportation networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future.

The excellence we bring to our work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We are among the LinkedIn Top 25 Companies two years in a row, one of the Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada's Top 100 Infrastructure Projects.

At WSP :

  • We value our people and our reputation
  • We are locally dedicated with international scale
  • We are future focused and challenge the status quo
  • We foster collaboration in everything we do
  • We have an empowering culture and hold ourselves accountable

WHITBY - Intermediate Environmental Consultant

We are a global leader in the Earth and Environment sector, made stronger with the recent acquisition of Golder. Globally headquartered in Montreal, where it all began, we proudly serve communities from coast to coast and beyond. With Golder now part of our WSP team, we have over 14,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change.

As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources, expertise, and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from marine biologists to geophysicists to geotechnical engineers and more.


The Opportunity:

With the recent acquisition of Golder, WSP’s Earth & Environment group further strengthened their position as a global leader, with a technical network unrivaled in the industry. WSP and Golder’s reputations for technical excellence and client focused service has been developed over decades and remain as strong as ever.

Our team is growing, and as a result WSP’s Earth & Environment group is currently seeking an Intermediate Environmental Consultant to join our Contaminated Lands team in Whitby, Ontario. Reporting to the Team Lead, Contaminated Lands – GTA-East, you will support our ambitious plans to enhance our service offering in the province through your work with a close-knit team of engineering specialists, professionals, and technical staff.


Why WSP?

  • We value and are committed to upholding a culture of Inclusion and Belonging
  • Our Flexible Work Policy – we recognize the importance of balance in our lives and encourage you to prioritize the balance in yours. We will support you on and off the job so you can be fully present in both your work and home lives.
  • A Canadian success story - we're proud to wear the red and white of this beautiful country and show the world what Canada has to offer.
  • Enhance the world around you - from the environment to the highways, to the buildings and the terrain, WSP is the fabric of Canada.
  • Outstanding career opportunities - we're growing and pushing ourselves every day to be greater than yesterday - we're open to your ideas and trying new things.
  • A phenomenal collaborative culture and a workforce filled with genuinely good people who are doing humbly important work. Come find out for yourself what it's like to be a part of our journey.

We offer attractive pay, flexible work options, a great corporate culture, comprehensive and employee-focused benefits including virtual healthcare and a wellness platform as well as great savings programs, and a clear vision for the future.

#WeAreWSP

A day in the life:

  • You demonstrate a “Safety-First” focus and act as a positive role model to your colleagues when you:
    • adhere to site-specific health and safety plans to mitigate or eliminate risks to you, WSP’s clients, employees, and the public;
    • identify and report potential and existing site hazards, near loss incidents and loss incidents.
  • You’ll be involved on projects primarily related to our Contaminated Lands services, including Phase I ESAs, Phase II ESAs and/or site remediation to support Risk Assessments and Record of Site Conditions (Ontario Regulation 153/04), as well as for general due diligence purposes. Your work will support our clients’ management of excess soil from their construction projects.
  • You will supervise and coach junior colleagues in their daily work, and engage independently with clients and contractors with the support of the Team Lead and other senior team members.
  • In the office, you will develop work programs, conceptual site models and prepare proposals. You will be a point of contact for clients and build long-term working relationships.
  • You will manage projects from the proposal stage through to delivery and project close-out, including schedule and budget control, client communication and invoicing support.
  • You'll prepare project documentation (e.g., health and safety and other planning documentation) and coordinate subcontractors and equipment for field programs.
  • You'll also carry out preliminary review of data interpretation and reporting deliverables, record reviews, prepare reports and assist with data tabulation and interpretation of laboratory reports
  • You'll have an opportunity to participate with senior staff in client engagement, business development and long-term business strategies.
  • In the field, your work will include, but not be limited to, supervision and training of more junior staff with their soil logging and sampling, surveying, groundwater and surface water sampling, stream flow measurements, soil vapour sampling and indoor air sampling.
  • You will maintain excellent field notes and perform, and record work tasks as requested = while adhering to current industry standards and regulatory requirements.

We'd love to hear from you if you have ...

  • Have a bachelor or post-graduate degree in environmental sciences or engineering;
  • Are eligible for professional certification (P. Eng or P. Geo.) or working towards would be great, but isn't a requirement to apply;
  • Attention to detail and a passion for health and safety;
  • Are prepared to spend some time in the field as part of support the development of more junior staff;
  • Are willing to travel for work (short term work placements); and
  • Have a valid driver’s license, and access to a vehicle for light duty projects within the area (reimbursable).

Health and Safety is a core paramount value of WSP. Given the importance of keeping one another safe and the growing list of our clients including vaccination status as part of their mandated health and safety requirements to work with them, you will be required to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to WSP as a condition of employment. You may also be required to undergo additional immunization to maintain a fully vaccinated status against COVID-19 whenever local Public Health Authorities recommend additional immunization.

Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).

WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.

WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. For more information please READ THE FULL POLICY.

WSP Canada Inc.


Whitby, ON

Show more

title: Lineage & Bordereaux Processor
description:
Built on meritocracy, our unique company culture rewards self-starters and those who are committed to doing what is best for our customers.
Company Background
Special Risk Insurance Managers Ltd. is an industry leading Managing General Agent established over 20 years ago. Our roots derive from a long serving sports, entertainment and lifestyle insurance provider (Sports-Can Insurance Consultants) and we have grown to encompass a wide range of niche and specialty products including aviation, marine, specialty casualty, accident, AD&D and hard to place property.
We are looking to add to our growing team with a full or part-time Lineage & Bordereaux Processor. This position is suitable for those without any industry knowledge, but with a keen eye for detail as the role deals with critical data required by our most trusted market partners.
Due to the ongoing circumstances with the Covid-19 pandemic, you must have the ability to work from home for the foreseeable future, with the potential expansion to a hybrid in office/ home work model.
Duties:
  • Process/enter data for a variety of policy transaction types within a portal system or Excel spreadsheet
  • Communicate internally via email & telephone
  • Clerical duties, such as electronic filing as required
Minimum Job Qualifications & Key Personal Attributes:
  • Strong organizational & time management skills to complete assignments effectively and within structured timelines
  • Strong writing/language & communication skills
  • Keen eye for detail
  • Interest in being involved with community outreach and company culture
  • Understanding of Microsoft Office Suite, Microsoft Office 365 & Google Drive is an asset
  • High school diploma
What SRIM has to offer:
  • A fulfilling company culture that provides personal support & mentorship, professional growth & career advancement opportunities
  • A positive & collaborative environment
  • Teammates are rewarded on performance & achievement of goals
  • We encourage and subsidize continuing education & professional designations
  • Extended medical & dental benefits through Canada Life (available to full-time employees only)
  • Employee Stock Purchase Plan through our parent company Brown & Brown, Inc. (BRO) (available to full-time employees only)
  • RRSP Matching Program (available to full-time employees only)
  • All required equipment is provided
Job Type: Part-time Permanent (15-25 hrs/week)
**Working hours are flexible, however, must be available within standard operating hours for training purposes at start & on occasion**
Location: British Columbia
Starting Salary: $35,100-$38,000 ($18-19.50/hr)
Anticipated Start Date: April – May 2022
Resumes can be sent to
snorfield@srim.ca
. Only those applicants selected for interview will be contacted.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We take pride in the diversity of our team and seek diversity in our applicants.

title: Terminal Operations Manager
description:
At Integrated Logistics, we provide expert material handling and marine transportation support. We are a proven leader in supply chain management solutions throughout Newfoundland and Labrador.

We handle a variety of cargoes associated with capital projects, large and small, including transfers between ships, barges, marshalling areas, warehouses, and ground transportation while minimizing the risk of lost and damaged freight, as well as loss of production time.

Our delivery platform is built on professionally trained staff, focused on safety and efficiency, and operating certified equipment as required for each logistics plan. Fast growing, we pride ourselves in providing a great place to work and strive. We are committed to maintaining a diverse workforce and an inclusive work environment.

PORT/MARINE TERMINAL OPERATIONS MANAGER

Based in Argentia

The opportunity

Reporting to the Vice President and Chief Operating Officer, the Port/Marine Terminal Operations Manager leads the field services team with the provision of stevedoring and related services at the port of Argentia.

Your leadership qualities and your expertise in operations management will be put to full use in this leadership role, being responsible for operations at our marine terminal located in St. Jonh’s Argentia. You will plan, organize and coordinate ship loading and unloading operations as well as terminal operations and lead a team of superintendents and operational staff to meet operational targets in terms of health and safety, operational excellence, customer satisfaction, leadership and sustainable development.

Planning for each project, you will ensure that the required resources are available (material, equipment, labor) and efficiently deployed. You will follow up on daily activities, track operational performance against key performance indicators and bring continuous improvements to IL’s operational and administrative processes. Leading by example, you will pitch in and join forces with the operations teams when needed.

You will also be a major contributor to new project submission and act as a primary liaison between the internal team, clients, consultants, staff, subcontractors and other stakeholders.

Your responsibilities will include:

Project Management

  • Performing project planning and budgeting activities
  • Coordinating materials and equipment along with determining and scheduling resources
  • On-boarding all parties in line with project plans effectively
  • Monitoring progress towards projects plans and operational performance measures and initiating actions to meet targets

Health and Safety

  • Ensuring operational site, facilities and equipments meets safety requirements
  • Providing the project safety statistics and information in project reporting, safety meetings, tool box talks etc.
  • Leading audits for safety and quality assurance

Leadership and operational support

  • Participating in the tendering of new projects, RFPs submission and customer relationships
  • Managing the labor pool, overseeing recruitment/labor sourcing, training and scheduling activities
  • Ensuring proper communication with staff, performance feedback as well as compliance with IL values, policies, procedures and collective agreements.
  • Working closely with the superintendent, providing daily coordination and support

About You

You are an experienced leader, driven and highly organized, with a strong hands-on approach. Your experience profile includes the following:

  • 8+ years of relevant experience in operations management, including staff supervision in a unionized environment preferably in manufacturing, mining, logistics or construction
  • Practical experience in the application of preventive measures in occupational health and safety, continuous improvement processes, supervision and project management
  • Working experience with rigging crane and lifting protocols
  • Demonstrated track record of improving operational efficiency while meeting/exceeding company/client’s needs
  • Experience with operating equipment/truck is an asset

Your key strengths include:

  • Engaging leadership
  • Customer focus
  • Communication skills
  • Strong planning and budgeting competencies
  • Excellent interpersonal skills to work with professionals across disciplines
  • Superior time-management and organization skills
  • Strong technological ability with advanced skill-level in MS Excel, SAP is an asset
  • This is a full-time position which requires availability on a flexible schedule: day/night shifts including weekends

You may occasionally be required to travel across our IL network

Reward and Recognition

You will have the opportunity to deepen your knowledge and skills, work with inspiring colleagues, influential clients and be part of a winning team. We invest in our people and provide a comprehensive benefits package, professional development and career opportunities.

Type d'emploi : Temps plein, Permanent

Avantages :

  • Assurance Dentaire
  • Assurance Invalidité
  • Assurance Maladie Complémentaire
  • Régime de retraite
  • Stationnement sur place

Horaire :

  • Disponibilité la fin de semaine

title: Director Maritime Business Development
description:
Position Description:
Serco Canada Marine is seeking a dynamic individual to be responsible Maritime Business Development to join our team to assist the Business Unit to grow our domestic and international ship design and marine engineering business.

You will be responsible for identifying, analyzing, and developing business opportunities for Serco Canada Marine in accordance with the SCM business strategy. You will lead, manage, and guide the Capture and Proposal Teams through the Serco opportunity lifecycle process.

You will lead, manage, and guide the capture, solutioning, and proposal teams through the Serco opportunity lifecycle. You will report directly to the General Manager of SCM and work with the BD Leads for other Business Units. You will participate in the development of SCM strategies and plans.


In this role you will be responsible for developing new business opportunities, both domestically and internationally and capturing identified opportunities:


  • Identify, analyze, and develop business opportunities. Research and analyze market opportunities and recommend opportunities for pursuit. Research public domain materials to develop leads, and contacts. Establish customer contacts particularly targeted at maritime commercial, defence, and international customers. Prepare market strategy presentations.
  • Work closely with operational personnel to gather, assess, and validate customer requirements. Plan and organize capture strategy to include white papers, RFIs, sources sought, workshops, gap analysis, call plans, solutioning, gate reviews, black hat sessions, collaboration sessions, budgets, and pre-RFP proposal preparation schedules and reviews.
  • Gain internal support, operate independently with limited supervision and feedback, and establish a solid working relationship with technical staff, managers, and peers across Serco.
  • Develop and maintain strong customer relationships within both government and shipyards. Establish and maintain working relationships with similar and/or complementary companies to include teaming and partnership discussions.
  • Working with communications consultants, lead the marketing of the company’s capabilities. Establishing marketing opportunities with the greatest impact within a marketing budget.

Qualifications:
To be considered for this roll the Marine Project Manager will have:
  • A Bachelor’s degree.
  • 10 years relative work experience is required.
  • The candidate must exhibit leadership traits, well developed management skills, and have the ability to obtain a broad knowledge of Serco’s products and services, as well as the needs of current and potential customers, and assist in establishing strategic direction from that knowledge.
  • The candidate must demonstrate extensive knowledge, experience, and success in winning captures of large-scale opportunities.
  • Strong knowledge and understanding of the marine industry is a must.
  • Demonstrated working knowledge of the federal procurement process is required.
Knowledge of the Canadian government’s procurement processes is considered an asset.
  • Excellent interpersonal, problem solving, and business acumen. Ability to influence constructively and interact at high levels of the corporate structure. Confidence and experience dealing with senior executives; ability to work efficiently in fast-paced, time-sensitive and often multi-tasking environment.
  • Ability to travel, as necessary in support of an opportunity pursuit.
  • Ability to use automated tools such as Microsoft Office to present ideas, information, and reports.

Additional desired experience and skills:
  • Possessing or the ability to obtain Canadian Security Clearances (Reliability/Controlled Good or higher) maybe considered an asset or maybe required for the role.
Company Overview:
Serco Inc. (Serco) is the Americas division of Serco Group, plc. Serco serves every branch of the U.S. military, numerous U.S. Federal civilian agencies, the Intelligence Community, the Canadian government, state and local governments, and commercial clients. We help our clients deliver vital services more efficiently while increasing the satisfaction of their end customers. Headquartered in Herndon, Virginia, Serco Americas has over 9,000 employees and is part of a $4 billion global business that helps transform government and public services around the world. At Serco, our employees are our most valuable asset - we listen, respect and support them throughout their career at Serco. We invite you to become part of our dynamic team. Serco is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying our workforce (Race/ Color/ Sex/ Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity/ Religion/ National Origin/ Disability/ Vets).

To review Serco benefits please visit: https://www.serco.com/na/careers/benefits-of-choosing-serco.

If you require an accommodation with the application process please email: careers@serco-na.com or call the HR Service Desk at 800-628-6458, option 1. Please note, due to EEOC/OFCCP compliance, Serco is unable to accept resumes by email.

Serco does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies without being a contracted approved vendor. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Serco and will not be obligated to pay a placement or contract fee. If you are interested in becoming an approved vendor at Serco, please email Agencies@serco-na.com.

COVID-19 Regulations: Serco complies with all applicable COVID-19 requirements. This may require employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19, provide attestations regarding vaccination status and/or COVID-19 testing, or satisfy other conditions of employment that Serco deems appropriate, and employees may be required to show proof of vaccination and/or negative COVID-19 test results as a condition of employment (except in limited circumstances where an employee is legally entitled to an accommodation).
Show more

title: Terminal Operator
description:
The Role

Job Duties include but are not limited to:

  • Oversee daily operations of the terminal.

  • Demonstrate capability to focus on the adoption of safe operating procedures.

  • Perform daily inspection and routine maintenance in accordance with the terminal operating standards.

  • Develop, update, and adhere to Local Operating Procedures and Checklists.

  • Participate and support optimization of schedule for product movements from ships (MET Site), rail (LOT Site), pipeline and truck.

  • Recognize and manage environmental and hazardous materials transportation risks in compliance to regulations.

  • Use and diagnose issues with automated product movement control and inventory management systems.

  • Communicate and collaborate with internal support groups and government agencies.

  • Perform daily reconciliation of inventories of products and record data using distribution management systems.

  • Supervise drivers loading and offloading hydrocarbons and additives products.

  • Supervise contractors and maintenance services (MET & LOT) through Permit to Work with effective communications and safety leadership.

  • Supervise connection/disconnection of marine hoses and mooring/unmooring activities (MET Site).

  • Perform rail loading/offloading including connection/disconnection, opening/closing of railcars (LOT Site).

  • Ascend and descend large bulk storage tanks to complete sampling, level checking, gas testing, and general inspections of the tanks.

  • Demonstrate capability and interest to use IT systems (desktop, tablet, smart phone, etc) to input various data and information (eg shift logs, shift rounds, work orders, etc), including basic troubleshooting of the systems during use.

  • Understand and monitor product quality parameters against criteria and liaise with internal and external resources to ensure trouble-free operations and maximize the reliability of the terminal.

Requirements:

  • College degree or Attestation of Collegial Studies in chemical process engineering, mechanical, civil or equivalent experience.

  • Excellent communication in French and functional English.

  • Ability and motivation to perform administrative tasks.

  • Proven ability to priories and perform multiple tasks.

  • Excellent time management and organizational skills.

  • Excellent flexibility, autonomy and ability to work effectively with minimal supervision.

  • Good computer skills, ability to use basic Office Microsoft.

  • Team spirit and dedication.

  • Must be able to work flexible hours (rotating schedule/12 hours shift) and overtime.

  • Good physical condition to allow for work in varying environmental conditions (rain, heat, cold, snow), as well as climbing ladders and tanks, going up and down stairs, working at heights on walkways and in confined spaces.

  • Using safe lifting techniques, that person must be able to lift a load of 20 kg from floor to waist level.

  • Must be allowed by law to work in Canada full-time on behalf of any employer other than their current employer.

  • Role is considered Safety Sensitive Position subject to Fitness For Duty testing.


Translated Company Description

Les tâches dans le rôle incluent sans s’y limiter:

  • Superviser les activités quotidiennes du terminal.

  • Démontrer une capacité à mettre l’accent sur l’adoption de méthodes d’exploitation sécuritaires.

  • Exécuter des inspections quotidiennes et de travaux d'entretien courants conformément aux normes d'exploitation du terminal.

  • Développer, mettre à jour et adhérer aux procédures locales et listes de vérification.

  • Participer et optimiser les horaires pour les mouvements de produits marins (site MET), wagons (site LOT), pipelines et camions.

  • Reconnaitre et gérer conformément aux réglementations applicables les risques environnementaux et les risques associés au transport de matériel dangereux.

  • Utiliser et diagnostiquer les problématiques avec les systèmes de contrôle automatisés et de gestion d’inventaires.

  • Communiquer et collaborer avec les groupes supports internes et les agences gouvernementales.

  • Effectuer les réconciliations hebdomadaires des inventaires et maintenir les données dans les systèmes de gestion.

  • Superviser les chauffeurs effectuant les chargements et déchargements de produits pétroliers et additifs.

  • Superviser les entrepreneurs et services d’entretien (MET et LOT) via l’émission de permis de travail, établir des communications efficaces et démontrer un leadership engagé envers la sécurité.

  • Superviser les opérations de transbordement marins ainsi que les tâches reliées à cette opération (branchement/débranchement de boyaux, amarrage et désamarrage de navire), puis agir à titre d’agent de sureté lors de ces mouvements. /

  • Effectuer les chargements/déchargements incluant les branchements/débranchements et ouvertures/fermetures des wagons (site LOT)

  • Monter et descendre de grands réservoirs d’entreposage pour échantillonner, vérifier le niveau de liquide, mesurer les vapeurs et effectuer des inspections générales.

  • Démontrer des capacités et intérêts à utiliser les systèmes informatiques (ordinateurs de bureau, tablettes, téléphones intelligents, etc.) afin d’y entrer des informations et données diverses (ex : rapports de quart, observations des rondes, ordres de travail, etc) incluant la capacité d’investiguer et résoudre des problématiques d’utilisation liées à ces systèmes.

  • Comprendre et vérifier les paramètres de qualité de produit vis-à-vis les critères et travailler en collaboration avec les ressources internes et externes pour assurer l’optimisation des opérations sans incident et de manière fiable.

Exigences:

  • Diplôme d'études collégiales ou Attestation d'études collégiales en techniques de procédés chimiques, mécanique, civil ou expérience équivalente.

  • Excellentes aptitudes pour les communications en français et anglais fonctionnel.

  • Capacité et intérêt à exécuter des tâches administratives.

  • Capacité éprouvée à prioriser et exécuter des tâches multiples.

  • Excellentes aptitudes pour la gestion du temps et excellent sens de l'organisation.

  • Dynamisme, autonomie et capacité de travailler efficacement avec un minimum de supervision.

  • Bonne connaissance de l'informatique, capacité d'utiliser la base Microsoft Office

  • Esprit d'équipe et dévouement.

  • Volonté de travailler selon un horaire rotatif (12h jour et 12 h nuit) et disponible pour du surtemps sur demande.

  • Bonne condition physique car le titulaire du poste doit travailler par mauvais temps (pluie, chaleur, froid, neige). La personne retenue pour ce poste doit être disposée et apte à monter sur des échelles et des réservoirs, à monter et à descendre des escaliers, à travailler en hauteur, sur des grillages surélevés et dans des espaces clos.

  • Au moyen de techniques de levage sécuritaires, cette personne doit être en mesure de soulever une charge de 20 kg du sol jusqu'au niveau de la taille.

  • Être autorisé par la loi à travailler au Canada à temps plein pour le compte de n’importe quel employeur autre que son employeur actuel.

  • La position est considérée « Sensible à la sécurité » et sujette à des tests d’aptitudes à la tâche.

Disclaimer

Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Royal Dutch/Shell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.-À NOTER: de temps à autre, il arrive que nous modifions ou que nous retirions des emplois chez Shell et nous nous réservons le droit de le faire à tout moment, y compris avant la date limite indiquée. Avant de candidater, il vous est conseillé de bien lire notre politique en matière de protection des données. Celle-ci décrit comment vos données personnelles peuvent être traitées et vous informe que vos données personnelles peuvent être transférées à Royal Dutch Shell/ aux sociétés du groupe Shell dans le monde entier. Ni le groupe Shell, ni aucune de ses sociétés de conseil en recrutement agréées ne sauraient vous demander de payer des droits pour examiner votre candidature à une carrière chez Shell. Quiconque vous demande un tel paiement n’est pas un représentant agréé de Shell et il vous est fortement conseillé de refuser d’effectuer un tel paiement. Shell respecte l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi
Show more

title: Senior Consultant, Management Consulting - People & Change
description:
Putting people first, every day:

BDO is a firm built on a foundation of positive relationships with our people and our clients. Each day, our professionals provide exceptional service, helping clients with advice and insight they can trust. In turn, we offer an award-winning environment that fosters a people-first culture with a high priority on your personal and professional growth.

Your opportunity:

BDO Canada’s Management Consulting Practice is a growing national practice helping our clients actively address and solve their business challenges. Our Ottawa office is looking for a Senior Consultant to join our People & Change team and own the following responsibilities:


  • Deliver high quality management consulting services in various areas including support of organizational and technology transformation, business planning and execution, research and analysis, and program / project management.
  • Support and/or lead client engagements from inception to close, using your business acumen and professional experience to generate insights and create value for BDO’s clients
  • Develop informative, compelling, and persuasive client-facing project deliverables, presentations, and collateral materials through available resources [including but not limited to: MS Office; Collaboration Tools; etc.)
  • Build trust and confidence with our clients – serving as a trusted advisor – to contribute to developing practical solutions that will last
  • Collaborate with a high-quality delivery team in support of individual and team growth
  • Develop trusting relationships across BDO’s diverse teams of business service professionals, including embedding yourself in local and national network of specialists in Tax, Accounting, Advisory and Legal Services
  • Support the advancement of business opportunities with new and existing BDO clients, including the development of thought leadership, methodologies and approaches, and business development products that will grow your own and BDO’s presence in the local business community
  • Participate in industry and service-based functional teams to progress national practices and leverage achievements across geographies

Some of the client challenges our team have been engaged on in the past year include:

  • Developing a consistent approach and related processes to define the single intake and prioritization of technology solutions from different program areas of a large, technologically-driven organization
  • Supporting the development and implementation of a marine spatial plan to enable proper planning and coordination of activities to advance economic growth in balance with significant threats from climate change, pollution, and competing demands on resources
  • Conducting a comprehensive review of an organization’s commitments regarding their accessibility infrastructure to ensure they are aligned to the requirements of the new Accessible Canada Act
  • Improving the effectiveness and efficiency of key business processes to enhance transparency, and foster stronger relationships with key partners, in support of an organization’s strategic Indigenous initiative
  • Assessing organizational capabilities against leading practices and relevant policies and guidelines in a complex, IT-enabled project-based environment to inform continuous improvement efforts


How do we define success for your role?

  • You demonstrate BDO's core values through all aspect of your work: Integrity, Respect and Collaboration
  • You understand your client’s industry, challenges, and opportunities; client describe you as positive, professional, and delivering high quality work
  • You identify, recommend, and are focused on effective service delivery to your clients
  • You share in an inclusive and engaging work environment that develops, retains & attracts talent
  • You actively participate in the adoption of digital tools and strategies to drive an innovative workplace
  • You grow your expertise through learning and professional development


Your experience and education

  • You have completed a relevant post-secondary program to obtain a degree / diploma
  • You have completed or are interested in pursuing professional designation(s); Examples include but are not limited to: CMC, PMP, Prosci, and Lean Six Sigma
  • You have a minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience in professional services (e.g., consulting) or comparable setting
  • You have excellent communication skills – both verbal and written – in English; Bilingual capacity in French is considered an asset
  • You are passionate about learning and exploring new ideas, opportunities, and challenges
  • You have an acumen for applying effective and efficient solutions that provide a positive impact to client’s problems
  • You display strong problem solving and analytical skills as well as writing and communication skills
  • You have or qualify to obtain a Government of Canada security clearance


Why BDO?


Our firm is committed to providing an environment where you can be successful in the following ways:

  • We enable you to engage with the firm's strategic plan, and be a key contributor to the success and growth of the firm.
  • We help you be the best professional you can be in our services, industries, and markets.
  • Achieve your personal goals outside of the office and make an impact on your community.

Giving back, it adds up: Where company meets community. BDO is actively involved in our communities by supporting local charity initiatives. We support staff with local and national events where you will be given the opportunity to contribute to your community.

Total rewards that matter: We pay for performance with competitive total cash compensation that recognizes and rewards your contribution. We provide flexible benefits from day one, and a market leading personal time off policy. We are committed to supporting your overall wellness beyond working hours, and provide reimbursement for wellness initiatives that fit your lifestyle.

Everyone counts: We believe every employee should have the opportunity to participate and succeed. Through leadership by our Chief Inclusion and Diversity Officer, we are committed to a workplace culture of respect, inclusion, and diversity. We recognize and celebrate the valuable differences among each of us, including race, religious beliefs, physical or mental disabilities, age, place of origin, marital status, family status, gender or gender identity and sexual orientation. If you require accommodation to complete the application process, please contact us.


As a hybrid workplace, all BDO personnel are expected to spend some of their time working in the office, at the client and remotely unless accommodations or alternative work arrangements are in place. To protect the health and safety of our people, clients and communities, we may require all partners and employees to be COVID-19 fully vaccinated in order to enter a BDO office. Individuals that cannot be fully vaccinated with a Health Canada approved vaccine due to medical reasons or another protected ground under Human Rights legislation may request an accommodation.

Ready to make your mark at BDO? Click “Apply now” to send your up-to-date resume to one of our Talent Acquisition Specialists.

To explore other opportunities at BDO, check out our careers page.


#LI-SS

Show more

title: Senior Manager, Strategy
description:
Senior Manager, Strategy

Located at 3099 Barrington Street in Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada, B3K 5M7, and 35 Micmac Boulevard, Dartmouth, Nova Scotia, Canada, B3A 4Y8, Irving Shipbuilding has a proud history as Canada's shipbuilder. A proud member of the J.D. Irving, Limited group of companies, we have been building quality vessels and fabricated modules for more than 50 years, and our Halifax Shipyard has been at the forefront of Canadian shipbuilding for 130 years.


Since 2012, we have invested more than $400 million in facilities, people, processes, and technology, making Halifax Shipyard one of the most modern and capable shipyards in North America. Over the next 30 years our shipbuilders will construct 20+ modern patrol ships and surface combatants for the Royal Canadian Navy as part of Canada's National Shipbuilding Strategy, the largest defence procurement in Canadian history. This year we delivered the second lead Arctic and Offshore Patrol Ship, the largest Navy ship built in Canada in 50 years and we're just getting started. The third ship will be delivered in 2022.


We're growing our team with career-defining opportunities that will revitalize Canada's shipbuilding industry and provide Canada's sailors with the ships they need to protect Canada's interests at home and abroad. Our workforce of over 2,000 will grow to more than 2,800 at peak construction of the Canadian Surface Combatants. We have built more than 80% of Canada's current combatant fleet and continue to perform maintenance and modernization work on the ships, including the Halifax-class frigates.


Irving Shipbuilding Inc. is seeking a Senior Manager, Strategy.

This is a permanent full-time role based in Halifax Regional Municipality, Nova Scotia. The primary language of work is English. We encourage applications from qualified African Nova Scotians, racially visible persons, women (applying for non-traditional positions), persons with disabilities, Aboriginal persons and persons of the LGBTQ+ community. ISI encourages applicants to self-identify in the cover letter/resume portion of your application. Irving Shipbuilding Inc. is committed to the principle of equal opportunity in its employment practices and to providing an environment where all employees feel supported and valued.


Reporting to the Senior Director, Strategy and Governance, the Senior Manager Strategy will work with the ISI Leadership Team to develop and execute our long-term strategy. This includes developing and implementing an aligned strategic planning framework, implementing processes to improve our organizational effectiveness throughout the strategic planning cycle, leading the development of our business plan, and ensuring measures are in place to support the achievement of our business objectives. Key to successful implementation of the strategy will be overseeing a portfolio of strategic projects across the business, with measures in place to track their effectiveness in driving toward our strategic goals and business objectives. The Senior Manager Strategy will work across the entire business, including the Arctic Offshore Patrol, Canadian Surface Combatant and Ship Repair Programs.


Qualifications:

  • Academically qualified with a recognized university bachelor’s degree in Engineering, business or a related field. A recognized university bachelor’s degree in Naval Architecture or Marine Engineering would be considered an asset
  • 20 Years or more experience in a Project Management role, Strategy role, or similar in the shipbuilding industry.
  • Experience in engineering, supply chain, production, or program management would be considered an asset
  • A Registered Engineering Professional (P.Eng) or PMP certification would be considered an asset
  • Effective written and oral communication with outstanding presentation skills
  • Excellent change management skills with the ability to think strategically and effectively problem solve

All successful applicants must meet requirements for Canadian Controlled Goods Program (CGP), Canadian Government Security clearance, and U.S. International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR).


Key Responsibilities:

  • Establish a Strategy Roadmap that integrates with the annual business planning cycle and the Irving Management System. Seek feedback from the business to continually improve and embed the system in the business
  • Collaborate with the Leadership team and consultants to align existing processes and systems (including budgeting cycle, scorecards, continuous improvement resources and core processes) with the Strategic Management timeline
  • Lead the development and execution of strategy sessions with the Executive Team, at least quarterly, to update and gain feedback on all core elements of the strategic plan
  • Collaborate with Senior and Departmental Leaders to align departmental goals, processes, and resource allocation to the ISI strategy
  • Oversee a portfolio of strategic projects across the business, with measures in place to track their effectiveness in driving toward our strategic goals and business objectives
  • Consult with Government Relations and other market intelligence sources to understand external threats and opportunities within the Shipbuilding industry; as well as incorporate these into appropriate elements of the Strategic Plan.
  • Support and guide senior level decision-making processes, such as the selection of strategic initiatives and make-buy decisions by collaborating with the teams to ensure all relevant information is available and organized
  • Consult with internal customers to ensure their needs are met and understood
  • Build strong and trusting working relationships across all areas and levels in the business

What We Offer:

Irving Shipbuilding is proud to offer a competitive salary and benefits package, including but not limited to:

  • A flexible medical, dental, and vision plan;
  • Employee & Family Assistance Programs;
  • RRSP matching program;
  • Health & Wellness reimbursements;
  • Opportunities to take part in job related training and development;
  • Growth and progression opportunities within Irving Shipbuilding and the larger network of the JD Irving group of companies.
  • Relocation costs (if applicable)

Please be advised that some positions within our business have been designated as ‘Safety Sensitive’ where the employee holding the position has a heightened responsibility for his/her own safety or the safety of others due to the nature of the job. If this is the case, you will be informed in the interview process.


For further details, please contact Kyle Burke at Burke.Kyle@irvingshipbuilding.com.



To Apply for this Career Opportunity:



Please complete the online application form. An up-to-date resume of past experience and education is required.

All applications will be reviewed by one of our recruiters. If the recruiter sees a potential opportunity (current or future) that matches your skills and experience, you will be contacted to discuss your qualifications for a position with Irving Shipbuilding.

We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.


Irving Shipbuilding Inc. is committed to the principle of equal opportunity in its employment practices and to providing an environment free from discrimination and harassment for all employees.



We do not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms or employment agencies, and we are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Show more

title: Civil Quality Advisor
description:
EXPRESSION OF INTEREST

Pennecon is a leading provider of integrated solutions throughout the heavy civil, industrial, services & maintenance, and marine industries. Powered by an energetic team all across Canada, we are united by our passion and determination to deliver results on the most complex jobs and challenging environments.

Pennecon Heavy Civil is currently bidding on major project work within the Western Canadian region and are seeking individuals who are qualified and interested in joining our team in the role of:


Role: Civil Quality Advisor

Location: Western Canada

The successful candidates will work in the field and be responsible to support the Company’s site quality program through support from the corporate office. Your accountabilities will include:

  • Provide technical interpretation of plans and specifications to site construction supervision and sub-contractors,
  • Coordinate inspections and testing with consultants as required,
  • Provide surveillance of subcontractor quality activities,
  • Complete quality reports for Quality Manager and Project Managers review,
  • Prepare and review inspection/test plans,
  • Verify/inspect and document the completion of all construction activities and punch-list items,
  • Provide assistance in the prevention of quality issues and in taking corrective actions;
  • Complete material receiving reports;
  • Assist Quality Manager in the development of work packages for turnover completions

The ideal candidate will have a bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering or Diploma in Civil Engineering Technology, along with 3-5 years of relevant experience as a Quality Inspector / Coordinator, or heavy experience in the field. The successful candidate is passionate about the work they do and has excellent interpersonal, communication, organizational and computer skills; with a commitment to safe work practices and are an effective team player with a positive attitude. Experience working in a Construction environment where responsiveness and ability to work and adapt to varying environments will be critical in this role. There is an expectation to work extended work schedules, which includes holidays and weekends.

There is an expectation to work extended work schedules, which includes holidays and weekends. Travel away from home will be required. Preferred candidates will be open to travel and construction project work, and be on a defined rotation work schedule. Competitive living out allowance will be provided.

Pennecon is committed to equity in employment and encourages all qualified individuals to apply. We thank all candidates for their interest, but wish to advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Find out more about Pennecon by visiting our website at www.pennecon.com.

title: Environment and Remedial Works - Coordinator of Special Projects
description:
Core Functions:
The Coordinator of Special Projects will work in collaboration with the Protected Areas and Conservation Specialist (PACS) and the Parks Canada Agency on the delivery of a feasibility assessment concerning the establishment of a National Marine Conservation Area in Eastern James Bay. The incumbent is also responsible for the development, coordination and monitoring of projects funded through the Contribution Agreement with the Parks Canada Agency.

Functional Responsibilities:
  • Develop work plan and coordination of projects for the Feasibility Assessment with the assistance of the PACS, the Parks Canada Agency, the Cree local administration, and Cree Entities when requested or required.
  • Ensure compliance with regional and communities’ laws, applicable standards, and established guidelines
  • Identify priorities and development of operational plans for various conservation programs, initiatives and projects within Cree communities and entities.
  • Collaborate with the Parks Canada project team to ensure effective cooperation on projects and advancement of the feasibility assessment file.
  • determine program priorities.
  • Organize and manage logistics for community consultations.
  • Develop and deliver presentations on protected areas programs and initiatives.
  • Collaborate with the Communications team to develop and implement a communication plan related to protected areas.
  • Liaise with various Cree Nation Government departments, Cree communities, Cree entities, and the Eeyou Istchee and Eeyou Marine Region Boards to access and implement applicable initiatives and projects.
  • Coordinate and complete projects on time and within the appropriate budget and scope.
  • Set deadlines, assign responsibilities, monitor and summarize progress of the projects.
  • Coordinate and collaborate with key stakeholders in the development of strategies, policies or actions related to projects under the Feasibility Assessment.
  • Engage in and/or manage specific research initiatives so as to improve the existing information on cultural, hydrology and wildlife programs.
  • Assist in the development of the protected areas network and its management through collaboration and consultations with the communities
Interaction/Communication Responsibilities
  • Provide advice, guidance, training and support to communities in relation to the responsibilities at the local level for all matters relating to projects funded through the Feasibility Assessment Contribution Agreement and other funding initiatives.
  • Respond to requests for technical support in the evaluation for needs for projects, the review of studies and the preparation and evaluation of documents required for local projects (terms of reference, evaluation of bids, selection of candidates, etc.).
  • Liaising with all pertinent internal and external parties to guarantee project advancement, proper management, and coordination with local governments.
  • Develop and maintain excellent working relations with Cree communities and organizations, key stakeholders and external consultants, in order to facilitate the development and delivery of programs.
Reporting Responsibilities
  • Develop and track budget based on action plans and forecasted project costs.
  • Collaborate with the Financial Program Technician (FPT) to monitor all transactions, expenses, invoices, and payments to ensure compliance with financial processes and procedures.
  • Assist the FPT to provide regular and accurate progress reports and final reports on approved projects and programs to the PACS.
  • Conduct follow-up assessments of all completed activities and evaluate project results.
Managerial Responsibilities
  • Supervise and lead direct reports.
  • Assist with development of team objectives, as well as individual objectives for direct reports by ensuring that performance is aligned with those objectives. Ensure that supervisors within team are establishing objectives that are in alignment with departmental objectives, in collaboration with the Department Director.
  • Identify training needs, recommend solutions, and support training and development.
  • Promote ongoing, effective and open communication with employees. Keep staff members informed of decisions that impact them and/or their department.
Other Responsibilities:
  • Maintain up-to-date knowledge and skills in area(s) of responsibility.
  • Perform other duties as required.
Qualifications:Education:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or related field.
Experience:
  • Three to five years of relevant experience.
  • Experience in project management in a northern context.
Language:
  • Fluency in verbal Cree and English.
  • Fluency in French is an asset.
Knowledge and Abilities:
  • Good knowledge of project management logistics.
  • Proven ability to communicate effectively.
  • Proven ability to be discrete and maintain confidentiality.
  • Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Strong organizational skills and the ability to coordinate multiple projects.
  • Strong judgment and proven ability to problem-solve.
  • Demonstrated ability to take initiative.
  • Demonstrated ability to work under pressure and to adapt to a changing environment
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office products.
Additional Requirements:
  • Typical office setting where there are no unusual physical demands.
  • Willingness to travel Regularly.
The Cree Nation Government may, at its discretion, waive any or all of the aforementioned requirements if a suitable candidate who is a JBNQA beneficiary accepts to follow a training plan determined by the Cree Nation Government as a condition of employment.
Show more

title: Intermediate Environmental Consultant
description:
WSP is one of the world's leading professional services firms. Our purpose is to future proof our cities and environments.

We have over 55,000 team members across the globe. In Canada, our 9,800+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transportation networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future.

The excellence we bring to our work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We are among the LinkedIn Top 25 Companies two years in a row, one of the Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada's Top 100 Infrastructure Projects.

At WSP :

  • We value our people and our reputation
  • We are locally dedicated with international scale
  • We are future focused and challenge the status quo
  • We foster collaboration in everything we do
  • We have an empowering culture and hold ourselves accountable

WHITBY


We are a global leader in the Earth and Environment sector, made stronger with the recent acquisition of Golder. Globally headquartered in Montreal, where it all began, we proudly serve communities from coast to coast and beyond. With Golder now part of our WSP team, we have over 14,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change.

As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources, expertise, and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from marine biologists to geophysicists to geotechnical engineers and more.


The Opportunity:

With the recent acquisition of Golder, WSP’s Earth & Environment group further strengthened their position as a global leader, with a technical network unrivaled in the industry. WSP and Golder’s reputations for technical excellence and client focused service has been developed over decades and remain as strong as ever.

Our team is growing, and as a result WSP’s Earth & Environment group is currently seeking an experienced Junior Environmental Consultant to join our Contaminated Lands team in Whitby, Ontario. Reporting to the Team Lead, Contaminated Lands – GTA-East, you will support our ambitious plans to enhance our service offering in the province through your work with a close-knit team of engineering specialists, professionals, and technical staff.


Why WSP?

  • We value and are committed to upholding a culture of Inclusion and Belonging
  • Our Flexible Work Policy – we recognize the importance of balance in our lives and encourage you to prioritize the balance in yours. We will support you on and off the job so you can be fully present in both your work and home lives.
  • A Canadian success story - we're proud to wear the red and white of this beautiful country and show the world what Canada has to offer.
  • Enhance the world around you - from the environment to the highways, to the buildings and the terrain, WSP is the fabric of Canada.
  • Outstanding career opportunities - we're growing and pushing ourselves every day to be greater than yesterday - we're open to your ideas and trying new things.
  • A phenomenal collaborative culture and a workforce filled with genuinely good people who are doing humbly important work. Come find out for yourself what it's like to be a part of our journey.

We offer attractive pay, flexible work options, a great corporate culture, comprehensive and employee-focused benefits including virtual healthcare and a wellness platform as well as great savings programs, and a clear vision for the future.

#WeAreWSP

A day in the life:

  • You demonstrate a “Safety-First” focus and act as a positive role model to your colleagues when you:
    • adhere to site-specific health and safety plans to mitigate or eliminate risks to you, WSP’s clients, employees, and the public;
    • identify and report potential and existing site hazards, near loss incidents and loss incidents.
  • You’ll be involved on projects primarily related to our Contaminated Lands services, including Phase I ESAs, Phase II ESAs and/or site remediation to support Risk Assessments and Record of Site Conditions (Ontario Regulation 153/04), as well as for general due diligence purposes. Your project work will support our clients’ management of excess soil from their construction projects
  • You will work under the support and direction of more experienced team members.

  • In the office, you will carry out record reviews, assist with data tabulation and interpretation of laboratory reports and report preparation You will also be responsible for preparation of project documentation and coordination of subcontractors and equipment for field programs.

  • In the field, your work may include, but not be limited to, soil logging and sampling, surveying, groundwater and surface water sampling, stream flow measurements, soil vapour sampling and indoor air sampling.

  • You will supervise subcontractors for ground disturbance and utility location, surveying, borehole drilling, groundwater well installation, test pit excavation and remedial excavations (e.g., tank removals).

  • In keeping with our culture of technical excellence, we expect that you maintain excellent field notes, and that you perform, and record work tasks as requested efficiently and accurately while adhering to current industry standards and regulatory requirements.


We'd love to hear from you if you have ...

  • A diploma or a bachelor’s degree in environmental sciences or engineering
  • Are eligible for professional certification (P. Eng or P. Geo.). If you’re not eligible, we’ll still consider you based on your experience!
  • Have 2 to 4 years of relevant working experience in the field of environmental site assessment
  • Have prior field experience with soil and/or groundwater sampling and working with subcontractors;
  • Attention to detail and a passion for health and safety;
  • Are prepared to spend at least part of your time in the field (enjoying the finest weather Ontario can offer);
  • Are willing to travel for work (short term work placements); and
  • Have a valid driver’s license, and access to a vehicle for light duty projects within the area (reimbursable).

Health and Safety is a core paramount value of WSP. Given the importance of keeping one another safe and the growing list of our clients including vaccination status as part of their mandated health and safety requirements to work with them, you will be required to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to WSP as a condition of employment. You may also be required to undergo additional immunization to maintain a fully vaccinated status against COVID-19 whenever local Public Health Authorities recommend additional immunization.

Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).

WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.

WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. For more information please READ THE FULL POLICY.

WSP Canada Inc.


Whitby, ON

Show more

title: Strategic Planning Coordinator (Term for a period of up to 2 Years)
description:
BE PART OF THE TEAM THAT BRINGS THE WORLD TOGETHER.

Career Opportunity: Strategic Planning Coordinator (Term for a period of up to 2 years)

Join an organization that plays a critical role in Canada’s economy. At the Vancouver Fraser Port Authority, we focus on doing the incredible work it takes to become the world’s most sustainable port.

The Vancouver Fraser Port Authority is responsible for the stewardship of the Port of Vancouver, Canada’s largest and most diversified port. Our mandate as a Canada Port Authority, as set out by the Canada Marine Act, is to enable Canada’s trade objectives, ensuring goods are moved safely and responsibly through the Port of Vancouver. That means providing infrastructure and ensuring the safe and efficient movement of marine traffic and cargo within the port. It also means we carry out reviews of proposed activities and developments on federal port lands and waters to determine whether a project can go ahead without impacts to the environment and community that cannot be mitigated.

We are passionate about the work we do and what it contributes to our local communities, the region and our country. This is reflected in our values of collaboration, continuous improvement, accountability and customer responsiveness.

Be a part of a team that advances initiatives to promote economic prosperity through trade, a healthy environment and thriving communities for the future generations of Canadians. It’s a workplace where the intrinsic value of your contribution to help foster the continued growth of the Canadian economy becomes a tangible reality. Bring your unique strengths, perspectives and experiences to the port authority and join us in charting a course toward a sustainable future.

The Strategic Planning Coordinator is responsible for providing integrated support and coordination of business planning activities and initiatives for the company, department, or specific projects. This position will assist with preparation and coordination of the port authority’s annual business planning process and related activities; support and help coordinate scenario planning processes, events and integration of outcomes into the port authority’s business planning process; provide budgeting, scheduling and coordination support to initiatives and projects related to the port authority’s implementation of its business plan; produce routine reports and submissions, briefing documents and other communications materials; and assist with other duties as required.

This role will:

Strategic Business Planning

  • Assist with scheduling and coordination of various activities carried out to review and update the port authority’s business plan including its annual strategic business planning process
  • Coordinate internal processes to update the port authority’s business planning documents on an annual basis including those related to its strategic initiatives and interdepartmental initiatives
  • Ensure the port authority’s business planning documents are maintained and published in a timely manner and readily accessible to users
  • Conduct research and analysis on a range of topics and prepare summaries, presentations and reports to inform strategic business planning
  • Assist with coordinating the logistics of internal strategic business planning retreats

Scenario Planning

  • Assist with the preparation and delivery of the port authority’s scenario planning initiative
  • Assist with procurement of scenario planning consultants and other contractors with appropriate expertise
  • Assist with the preparation and distribution of related materials such as agendas, reports, presentations and meeting minutes
  • Assist with planning and delivering and coordinate logistics for related events and workshops for internal and external participants including:
    • research and book appropriate venues and arrange for catering
    • coordinate and track participant invitations and attendance
    • coordinate suppliers, contractors, and staff in accordance with event plans
  • Coordinate activities to compile, monitor and analyze early warning indicators related to the port authority’s scenarios, preparing summary reports and presentations to communicate findings to a range of audiences

Project Coordination

For annual business planning processes, scenario planning processes and other projects as assigned, undertake a range of project coordination activities including:

  • Assist with the preparation of submissions, request for contracts and other internal process to obtain project approvals and authorizations
  • Prepare project charters, status reports and other project documentation
  • Follow up with appropriate staff, consultants and others on their open action items
  • Maintain and update project risk registers
  • Maintain and update project budgets
  • Develop presentations and other communication materials to provide project updates to various audiences

Continuous Improvement

  • Coordinate regular reviews of the department’s processes for the purposes of continuous improvement, organizing meetings and workshops as appropriate
  • Provide analysis of potential improvements and implementation approaches to procedures and processes
  • Track identified process improvement opportunities and the actions taken to address them
  • Coordinate and provide research background/supporting materials, briefing papers, presentations and other reports
The successful candidate have a two-year full-time post-secondary diploma in business, project management, or another acceptable diploma or degree from a recognized institution, along with a minimum of 2 years related experience in project planning, project coordination and process improvement. Must have excellent communication skills, both oral and written. Experience planning large events will be an asset. A high level of computer proficiency is required, including expertise with Microsoft Office programs including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Visio.

This position is ideal for a self-motivated and assertive individual with excellent interpersonal skills, including tact, diplomacy and the ability to liaise effectively and positively with both staff and outside contacts. The successful candidate will have an excellent written and verbal communication skills. Must be a team player with a "customer service" focus. Must have excellent analytical, organizational and people skills and flexibility to perform a diverse portfolio of tasks.

Normal office conditions, with occasional evening and weekend work at events.

The health and safety of our employees is a priority and the Vancouver Fraser Port Authority is committed to ensuring a safe workplace. Vaccinations, in combination with other preventative health and safety measures, offer the best available protection against COVID-19 and that is why port authority employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Providing proof of vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment.

Candidates may be accommodated for this requirement if they are approved for a legal exemption; accommodation may be requested only for religious and medical reasons, or other protected grounds under the Canadian Human Rights Act. If you’re seeking accommodation to the COVID-19 vaccination requirement, please indicate your request during the recruitment process.

The Port Authority offers a competitive compensation and benefits package including an Earned Time Off program.

This work is Canadian based employment and expected to be performed from our Vancouver office location.

Please note this posting will remain open until filled.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

At the port authority, we are dedicated to employment equity and a workplace reflective of the diversity of our port community.

Learn more about us at www.portvancouver.com
Show more

title: ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT
description:
ID #
20461
City
Vancouver
Job Type
Permanent - Full Time

WSP is one of the world's leading professional services firms. Our purpose is to future proof our cities and environments.

We have over 55,000 team members across the globe. In Canada, our 9,800+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transportation networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future.

The excellence we bring to our work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We are among the LinkedIn Top 25 Companies two years in a row, one of the Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada's Top 100 Infrastructure Projects.

At WSP :

  • We value our people and our reputation
  • We are locally dedicated with international scale
  • We are future focused and challenge the status quo
  • We foster collaboration in everything we do
  • We have an empowering culture and hold ourselves accountable

VANCOUVER

We are a global leader in the Earth and Environment sector, made stronger with the recent acquisition of Golder. Globally headquartered in Montreal, where it all began, we proudly serve communities from coast to coast and beyond. With Golder now part of our WSP team, we have over 14,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change.

As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources, expertise, and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from marine biologists to geophysicists to geotechnical engineers and more.


The Opportunity:

WSP Golder has a new opportunity for an Administrative Assistant I to join our Business Operations team in a Full-Time position in our Vancouver office.

Example: You’ll be part of our growing Business Support team, using your skills as an Administrative Assistant to support Environmental and Ground Engineering consultants, and colleagues, in a dynamic work environment. on major Infrastructure projects in Canada.


Why WSP?

  • We value and are committed to upholding a culture of Inclusion and Belonging
  • Our Flexible Work Policy – we recognize the importance of balance in our lives and encourage you to prioritize the balance in yours. We will support you on and off the job so you can be fully present in both your work and home lives.
  • A Canadian success story - we're proud to wear the red and white of this beautiful country and show the world what Canada has to offer.
  • Enhance the world around you - from the environment to the highways, to the buildings and the terrain, WSP is the fabric of Canada.
  • Outstanding career opportunities - we're growing and pushing ourselves every day to be greater than yesterday - we're open to your ideas and trying new things.
  • A phenomenal collaborative culture and a workforce filled with genuinely good people who are doing humbly important work. Come find out for yourself what it's like to be a part of our journey.

We offer attractive pay, flexible work options, a great corporate culture, comprehensive and employee-focused benefits including virtual healthcare and a wellness platform as well as great savings programs, and a clear vision for the future.

#WeAreWSP

A day in the life:


  • You will be printing, scanning, E-Filing and physical archiving of documents;
  • You will be archiving company records and library documents while following company retention policies using MS Access, Excel, SharePoint, and other internal programs. Also entails lifting, unpacking and re‑boxing of project files;
  • You will be tasked with accurate data-entry;
  • You will coordinate library shelving/re-filing and responding to requests for file retrievals
  • You will assist with office and cubicle moves and departures related tasks including; desk tidying and organization, filing, coordinating the return of extra office and IT equipment for redeployment;
  • You will assist Senior team members with coordinating equipment rentals (SAT phones, inReach devices) and coordinating fleet vehicle maintenance;
  • You will assist in maintaining a neat and tidy work area that is welcoming to visitors;
  • You may be asked to provide back-up reception coverage; and,
  • You will be involved in general office assistance to the Business Support team in the region as required.

What you'll bring to WSP ...


  • Positive Team Player Attitude!
  • 0-2 years of work experience in a professional service environment
  • Attention to detail and ownership of delegated tasks
  • Good communication skills (listening, verbal and written), friendly and pleasant manner
  • The ability to take directions and seek clarification as needed
  • Good problem-solving skills with the initiative and ability to identify alternative solutions
  • Established comfort level with technology
  • Proficiency in Office 365 including SharePoint, Word, Excel, and OneDrive is an asset
  • Ability to learn processes quickly and be flexible in changing circumstances
  • Excellent customer service skills to support our internal clients
  • Maturity and flexibility
  • Valid Drivers licence is an asset

Health and Safety is a core paramount value of WSP. Given the importance of keeping one another safe and the growing list of our clients including vaccination status as part of their mandated health and safety requirements to work with them, you will be required to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to WSP as a condition of employment. You may also be required to undergo additional immunization to maintain a fully vaccinated status against COVID-19 whenever local Public Health Authorities recommend additional immunization.

Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).

WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.

WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. For more information please READ THE FULL POLICY.

WSP Canada Inc.


Vancouver, BC

Show more
